titlestmt.titleproper: American Chemical Society Division of Inorganic Chemistry records 1956-1966
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: American Chemical Society Division of Inorganic Chemistry records

bioghist.p: The American Chemical Society (ACS), founded in 1876, is a self-governed individual membership organization that consists of more than 158,000 members at all degree levels and in all fields of chemistry. The Division of Inorganic Chemistry is one of the 33 technical divisions within the ACS. The division's goals include advancing the science of inorganic chemistry, providing networking opportunities for inorganic chemists, arranging programs and symposia on special topics and for the national meetings of the ACS, and promoting the teaching of inorganic chemistry at the undergraduate and graduate levels.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of records of the ACS Division of Inorganic Chemistry (1956-1966). Materials include annual reports, Executive Committee minutes, correspondence, divisional newsletters, records of various divisional committees, and documents relating to meetings and symposia.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

otherfindaid.p: A paper finding aid is available in the repository.
